Title: abbrev
Description: Creates an abbreviated display format as text. (The abbreviation consists of dropping all-zero octets to the right of the netmask; more examples are in Table 8.22.)

Title: broadcast
Description: Computes the broadcast address for the address's network.

Title: family
Description: Returns the address's family: 4 for IPv4, 6 for IPv6.

Title: host
Description: Returns the IP address as text, ignoring the netmask.

Title: hostmask
Description: Computes the host mask for the address's network.

Title: inet_merge
Description: Computes the smallest network that includes both of the given networks.

Title: inet_same_family
Description: Tests whether the addresses belong to the same IP family.

Title: masklen
Description: Returns the netmask length in bits.

Title: netmask
Description: Computes the network mask for the address's network.

Title: network
Description: Returns the network part of the address, zeroing out whatever is to the right of the netmask. (This is equivalent to casting the value to cidr.)

Title: set_masklen
Description: Sets the netmask length for a cidr value. Address bits to the right of the new netmask are set to zero.

Title: text
Description: Returns the unabbreviated IP address and netmask length as text. (This has the same result as an explicit cast to text.)

Title: trunc
Description: Sets the last 5 bytes of the address to zero. The remaining prefix can be associated with a particular manufacturer (using data not included in PostgreSQL).

Title: macaddr8_set7bit
Description: Sets the 7th bit of the address to one, creating what is known as modified EUI-64, for inclusion in an IPv6 address.
